definition: full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
lit. to gaze at the ocean and lament one's inadequacy (idiom)/fig. to feel powerless and incompetent (to perform a task)

sentences.english: But in the Mount Guia area.
sentences.chinese: 然而在整个东望洋山区域内。

sentences.english: As a shipwrecked sailor hates the sea.
sentences.chinese: 如翻船的水手望洋生怨。

sentences.english: Often inaccessible as a luxury brand must make sense.
sentences.chinese: 作为奢侈品牌必须制造望洋兴叹的感觉。

sentences.english: Guia Hill also known as Pine Tree, tourism is also a good place.
sentences.chinese: 东望洋山又名松山，也是旅游的好去处。

sentences.english: However, if the space is too large, charcoal can only be always bemoans.
sentences.chinese: 但如果空间面积过大，竹炭纤维也只能是望洋兴叹。

definition: to feel powerless and full of shame (idiom)
(old) name of a mountain in Gansu, where the setting sun was supposed to enter the earth
old variant of 慨[kai3]/to sigh (with emotion)
to stand on tiptoe and crane one's neck (idiom); fig. to yearn for sth
to look far ahead/to look forward (to)
